Craig Young, Security Researcher, Tripwire VERT reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the HP StoreOnce D2D Backup System interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.13.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docId=emr_na-c04858589

Title: (QNAP Systems Issues Fix for QNAP QTS) OpenSSH TTY Permissions Let Local Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. QNAP QTS is affected.
The system sets TTYs with world-writable permissions. A local user may be able to write arbitrary messages, including escape sequences, to other users on the target system.

Nikolay Edigaryev reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can write arbitrary messages, including escape sequences, to other users on the target system, which may cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
QNAP Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-6565 for QNAP QTS (4.2.0 RC2 (Build 0910)) [in September 2015].

The QNAP Systems advisory is available at:

https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=85

Title: (QNAP Systems Issues Fix for QNAP QTS) OpenSSH PAM Privilege Separation Bugs Lets Remote Users Gain Elevated Privileges in Certain Cases
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSH. A remote user can gain elevated privileges in certain cases. QNAP QTS is affected.
A remote user that can exploit a separate vulnerability in the unprivileged pre-authentication process to execute arbitrary code can then exploit two separate flaws in sshd(8) to bypass privilege separation controls [CVE-2015-6563, CVE-2015-6564].

Moritz Jodeit of Blue Frost Security GmbH reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user that can exploit an independent vulnerability in the pre-authentication process can bypass the privilege separation controls.
Solution:
QNAP Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-6563 and CVE-2015-6564 for QNAP QTS (4.2.0 RC2 (Build 0910)) [in September 2015].

The QNAP Systems advisory is available at:

https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=85

Title: (QNAP Systems Issues Fix for QNAP QTS) OpenSSH 'KbdInteractiveDevices' Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system. QNAP QTS is affected.
A remote user can request the keyboard-interactive authentication option ('KbdInteractiveDevices') to open a large number of keyboard-interactive devices on the target server and perform a brute-force password guessing attack against the target sshd service. The number of password attempts can effectively exceed the 'MaxAuthTries' limit and are permitted to occur until the 'LoginGraceTime' limit is reached or the number of keyboard-interactive devices are used.

Servers that have keyboard-interactive authentication enabled (e.g., FreeBSD in the default configuration) are affected.

A demonstration exploit command is provided:

ssh -l[username] -oKbdInteractiveDevices=`perl -e 'print "pam," x 10000'` [target]

The original advisory is available at:

https://kingcope.wordpress.com/2015/07/16/openssh-keyboard-interactive-authentication-brute-force-vulnerability-maxauthtries-bypass/

kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system.
Solution:
QNAP Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-5600 for QNAP QTS (4.2.0 RC2 (Build 0910)) [in September 2015].

The QNAP Systems advisory is available at:

https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=85

Title: (QNAP Systems Issues Fix for QNAP QTS) Apache Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apache. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. The impact of some vulnerabilities was not specified. QNAP QTS is affected.
A remote user can trigger a crash with ErrorDocument 400 pointing to a local URL-path with the INCLUDES filter active [CVE-2015-0253]. Versions 2.4.11 and after are affected. The vendor has assigned PR 57531 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted websockets ping to trigger a flaw in mod_lua and cause the target child process to crash [CVE-2015-0228]. The vulnerability occurs when the ping is received and then a script calls the r:wsupgrade() function.

A remote user can trigger a chunk header parsing flaw in apr_brigade_flatten() [CVE-2015-3183]. The impact was not specified.

A remote user can trigger an unspecified flaw in ap_some_auth_required() [CVE-2015-3185]. The impact was not specified.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
QNAP Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-3183 for QNAP QTS (4.2.0 RC2 (Build 0910)) [in September 2015].

The QNAP Systems advisory is available at:

https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=85

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Storwize V7000 Unified) Libuser Bugs Let Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Libuser. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. IBM Storwize V7000 Unified is affected.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the userhelper program to add linefeed characters in the middle of '/etc/password' records, causing the file to become corrupt [CVE-2015-3245].

A local user can exploit a flaw in the way libuser updates the '/etc/passwd' file to gain root privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-3246].

Qualys reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A local user can corrupt the '/etc/password' file to cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Storwize V7000 Unified (1.5.2.2).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=ssg1S1005336

Title: QNAP QTS Path Traversal Flaw Lets Local Users View and Modify Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in QNAP QTS. A local user can view and modify files on the target system.
A local user on an OS X system with Apple Filing Protocol (AFP) enabled can exploit a path traversal flaw to view and modify arbitrary files on the target system.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/751328

Marcin Ochab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can view and modify arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.1.4 Build 0910, 4.2.0 Build 0910(RC2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=85

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Storwize) Apache Struts Incorrect Default 'excludeParams' Configuration Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apache Struts. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. IBM Storwize is affected.
The system includes incorrect 'excludeParams' settings that override the settings defined in 'DefaultExcludedPatternsChecker'. A remote user can bypass these parameter restrictions to "compromise internal state of an application."

Jasper Rosenberg at Cargurus reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Storwize (IBM Storwize V7000, V5000, V3700, and V3500; 7.3.0.12, 7.4.0.5, 7.5.0.2).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=ssg1S1005335

Title: QNAP Turbo NAS Series Devices Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, Traverse the Directory, Execute Arbitrary Code, and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in QNAP Turbo NAS Series Devices. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the 'Change Password' function to gain elevated privileges.

Tony Martin reported this vulnerability.

The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the QNAP Storage Devices interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'Edit Account Profile page, File Station, Syslog Viewer, and System Connection Logs are affected.

Tony Martin reported this vulnerability.

The file sharing feature of the File Station is also affected.

Peter Kostiuk of Salesforce.com reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a CGI vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Luca Carettoni (via Beyond Security's SecuriTeam Secure Disclosure program) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Music Station component to traverse the directory and view files on the target system.

Peter Kostiuk of Salesforce.com reported this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the File Station component to traverse the directory and view files on the target system.

Peter Kostiuk of Salesforce.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the QNAP Storage Devices interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (QTS 4.1.4 build 0804).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=83

Title: QNAP Logging Error Lets Local Users Obtain Disk Encryption Keys
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in QNAP Storage Devices. A local user can obtain disk encryption keys.
When an encrypted device is unlocked, the system logs disk encryption keys to a world readable log file on an unencrypted hard disk partition. The system also rotates the log files.

A local user can invoke dmsetup to gain access to the encrypted device.

The vendor was notified on July 12, 2015.

Andreas Steinmetz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain disk encryption keys.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The report indicates that version QTS 4.1.4 build 0804 may include a fix.

[Editor's note: The vendor's advisory for QTS 4.1.4 build 0804 (https://www.qnap.com/i/en/support/con_show.php?cid=83) does not reference this vulnerability.]

Title: DRAM "Rowhammer" Memory Bit Flipping Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in some dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) devices. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a program that repeatedly accesses a row of memory to cause bits in adjacent rows to flip. This can be exploited to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.

Double data rate type 3 (DDR3) DRAM components from multiple vendors are affected.

[Editor's note: No publicly available list of affected vendor products was available at the time of this entry.]

This vulnerability is known as the DRAM "Rowhammer" vulnerability.

The original advisory, including demonstration exploit code, is available at:

http://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2015/03/exploiting-dram-rowhammer-bug-to-gain.html

Mark Seaborn and Thomas Dullien reported this vulnerability via Google Project Zero.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (HP Issues Fix for HP StoreOnce Backup Systems are) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaws Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. HP StoreOnce Backup Systems are affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
HP has issued a fix for CVE-2014-7169, CVE-2014-6271, CVE-2014-7187, and CVE-2014-7186 for HP StoreOnce Backup Systems.

The HP advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04477872-1

Title: HP StoreVirtual Bugs Let Remote Users Obtain Information and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): HP StoreVirtual 4000 Storage and StoreVirtual VSA 9.5, 10.0, 10.5, 11.0
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP StoreVirtual 4000 Storage and StoreVirtual VSA. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2014-2605].

A remote authenticated user can gain full control of the target system [CVE-2014-2606].

Calum Hutton reported this vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can gain full control of the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=1emr_na-c04281279-1

Title: HP StoreOnce Appliances Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Gain Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StoreOnce Appliances. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
No details were provided.

The following products are affected:

HP StoreOnce Virtual Storage Appliance (VSA)
HP StoreOnce 2610 iSCSI Backup System
BB852A HP StoreOnce 2620 iSCSI Backup System
BB853A HP StoreOnce 4210 iSCSI Backup System
BB854A HP StoreOnce 4210 FC Backup System
BB855A HP StoreOnce 4220 Backup System
BB856A HP StoreOnce 4420 Backup System
BB857A HP StoreOnce 4430 Backup System

Joshua Small of Daraco IT Services reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04126368-2

Title: EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition Input Validation Flaw in 'FileUploadController' Lets Remote Users Download Arbitrary Files
Version(s): EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition (CMCNE) 12.1.2
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Connectrix. A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can exploit an input validation flaw in the 'FileUploadController' servlet to view arbitrary files on the target system.

Bluesea (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition (CMCNE) 12.1.5).

Title: HP StoreVirtual Unspecified Flaw in dbd_manager Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): HP StoreVirtual 4000; HP LeftHand OS prior to version 11.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StoreVirtual. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

This product is formerly known as HP LeftHand Virtual SAN Appliance.

'e6af8de8b1d4b2b6d5ba2610cbf9cd38' reported this vulnerability via HP's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (HP LeftHand OS version 11.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03995204-1

Title: QNAP QTS Input Validation Flaw in 'jc.cgi' Lets Remote Users View Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in QNAP QTS. A remote user can view files on the target system.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted 'f' parameter value to 'cgi-bin/jc.cgi' to view files on target system.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/487078

An anonymous researcher (via US-CERT) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (QTS 4.1.0).

Title: EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition Servlet Bugs Let Remote Users View and Upload Files and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition (CMCNE) 11.2.1, 12.0.1 and 12.0.3
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can upload files to the target system. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can download files from the target EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition (CMCNE) system.

A remote user can upload arbitrary files to the target CMCNE system and then cause those files to be executed on the target system.

Andrea Micalizzi, aka rgod, reported this vulnerability (via HP's Zero Day Initiative).
Impact':
A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can upload files to the target system.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (EMC Connectrix Manager Converged Network Edition 12.1.2).

Title: HP StoreOnce D2D Backup System Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StoreOnce D2D Backup System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can cause the target system to become unavailable.

The vendor has assigned SSRT101258 to this vulnerability.

Versions 3.0.0 and later are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.19, 2.3.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03828580-1

Title: HP StoreVirtual Storage Undocumented Administrative Account Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StoreVirtual Storage. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The device includes an undocumented administrative account that cannot be disabled. A remote user with knowledge of the account and password can access the underlying LeftHand OS.

The following models are affected:

HP P4300
HP P4500
HP P4300 G2
HP P4500 G2
HP P4800 G2
HP P4900 G2
HP P4000 VSA
HP StoreVirtual 4130
HP StoreVirtual 4330
HP StoreVirtual 4530
HP StoreVirtual 4630
HP StoreVirtual 4730
HP StoreVirtual VSA
Dell PowerEdge 2950
HP DL320S
IBM System x3650
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix on or before July 17, 2013.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c03825537

Title: HP LeftHand Virtual SAN Appliance Undocumented Administrative Account Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP LeftHand Virtual SAN Appliance. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The device includes an undocumented administrative account that cannot be disabled. A remote user with knowledge of the account and password can access the underlying LeftHand OS.

The following models are affected:

LeftHand NSM2060
LeftHand NSM2060 G2
LeftHand NSM2120
LeftHand NSM2120 G2
LeftHand VSA
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix on or before July 17, 2013.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c03825537

Title: HP StoreOnce D2D Backup System Built-in Password Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StoreOnce D2D Backup System. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system includes a default user account 'HPSupport' with a hardcoded password. A remote user can access the system using the password.

Software version 3.0.0 or newer is not affected.

The following models are affected:

HP StoreOnce D2D4324 Backup System (EH985A)
HP StoreOnce D2D4312 Backup System (EH983B)
HP StoreOnce D2D4312 Backup System (EH983A)
HP StoreOnce D2D4112 Backup System (EH993C)
HP StoreOnce D2D4112 Backup System (EH993B)
HP StoreOnce D2D4106i Backup System (EH996B)
HP StoreOnce D2D4106i Backup System (EH996A)
HP StoreOnce D2D4106fc Backup System (EH998B)
HP StoreOnce D2D4106fc Backup System (EH998A)
HP StoreOnce D2D2504i Backup System (EJ002C)
HP StoreOnce D2D2504i Backup System (EJ002B)
HP StoreOnce D2D2502i Backup System (EJ001C)
HP StoreOnce D2D2502i Backup System (EJ001B)
HP D2D4112 Backup System (EH993A)
HP D2D4009fc Backup System (EH942A)
HP D2D4009i Backup System (EH939A)
HP D2D4004fc Backup System (EH941A)
HP D2D4004i Backup System (EH938A)
HP D2D2504i Backup System (EJ002A)
HP D2D2503i Backup System (EH945A)
HP D2D2502i Backup System (EJ001A)

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.lolware.net/hpstorage.html

Joshua Small reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03813919-1

Title: QNAP VioStor NVR Storage Devices Let Remote Users Access the System and Execute Arbitrary Shell Comands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): VioStor NVR firmware version 4.0.3; possibly prior versions
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in QNAP VioStor NVR Storage Devices. A remote user can gain access to the system. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The system uses a hard-coded guest account. A remote user can use the password to gain access via the web service [CVE-2013-0142].

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted query string to 'cgi-bin/pingping.cgi' to execute arbitrary shell commands [CVE-2013-0143].

A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the device acting as the target user [CVE-2013-0144]. The NEW USER action of the 'cgi-bin/create_user.cgi' script is affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/927644

Tim Herres and David Elze of Daimler TSS reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the system.

A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.

A remote user can take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: EMC VNX and EMC Celerra Control Station Lets Local Administrative Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC VNX and EMC Celerra Control Station. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with 'nasadmin' group privileges can invoke scripts that will execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.
Impact': A local user with 'nasadmin' group privileges can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (EMC VNX Control Station 7.1.70.2, EMC Celerra Control Station 6.0.70.1).

Title: IBM Storwize V7000 Unified Samba Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Modify Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM Storwize V7000 Unified. A remote authenticated user can modify files on the target share.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the Samba implementation to perform operations on the target Storwize V7000 Unified CIFS export that are not permitted by the CIFS share access control settings. This may include writing to read-only shares.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can modify files on the target share.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Storwize V7000 Unified 1.3.2.3, 1.4.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=ssg1S1004289

Title: Symantec NetBackup Appliance Management Console Lets Remote Authenticated Users Download Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec NetBackup Appliance. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
The Management Console web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote authenticated user can access privileged files on the target system.

Joe Durbin with Pen Test Partners reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can view critical files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.5.x).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20130320_00

Title: HP LeftHand Virtual SAN Appliance Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP LeftHand Virtual SAN Appliance. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The vendor was notified of CVE-2012-3282 on December 22, 2011.

The vendor was notified of the other vulnerabilities on March 14, 2012.

e6af8de8b1d4b2b6d5ba2610cbf9cd38 reported these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?DdocId=emr_na-c03661318-1

Title: HP IBRIX X9000 Storage Discloses Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP IBRIX X9000. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information to take full control of the target device.
No details were provided.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information and use that information to gain full control of the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.260).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03510876

Title: Iomega StorCenter EMC Lifeline Access Control Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Remote Shares
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Iomega StorCenter. A remote authenticated user can gain access to remote shares.
On Iomega network storage devices with EMC Lifeline firmware and with remote access (including port forwarding) enabled, a remote authenticated user can access arbitrary shares.

The following product versions are affected:

Home Media Network Hard Drive               2.064
Home Media Network Hard Drive Cloud Edition 3.1.14.995
iConnect                                    2.5.24.10916
StorCenter ix2                              2.0.15.43099
StorCenter ix2-200                          2.1.40.8151
StorCenter ix2-200 Cloud Edition            3.2.3.9273
StorCenter ix4-100                          2.0.15.43099
StorCenter ix4-200d                         2.1.40.8151
StorCenter ix4-200d Cloud Edition           3.2.3.9273
StorCenter ix4-200r                         2.1.40.8151 or 2.0.15.43099
StorCenter ix2-200                          2.1.40.8151
StorCenter ix12-300r                        3.2.3.9273
StorCenter px4-300d                         3.2.3.9273
StorCenter px4-300r                         3.2.3.9273
StorCenter px6-300d                         3.2.3.9273
StorCenter px12-350r                        3.2.3.9273
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain access to remote shares.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes.

Home Media Network Hard Drive                   2.104
Home Media Network Hard Drive Cloud Edition     3.2.3.15290
iConnect                                        2.5.26.18966
StorCenter ix2                                  2.0.18.23122

Title: HP StorageWorks File Migration Agent Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP StorageWorks File Migration Agent. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 9111 to trigger a buffer overflow in the 'HsmCfgSvc.exe' service and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Specially crafted CIFS archives and FTP archives can trigger an overflow.

The vendor was notified on April 11, 2011.

The original advisories are available at:

http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-12-126
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-12-127

AbdulAziz Hariri reported these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor recommends using a firewall on the underlying system.

Title: EMC Celerra/VNX/VNXe Access Control Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Files/Directories
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Celerra/VNX/VNXe. A remote authenticated user can access files and directories on the target file system.
A remote authenticated user can bypass access controls an gain unauthorized access to distributed files and directories on the target NFS file system.

The following product versions are affected:

EMC Celerra Network Server versions 6.0.36.4 through 6.0.60.2

EMC VNX versions 7.0.12.0 through 7.0.53.1

EMC VNXe 2.0 (including SP1, SP2, and SP3)

EMC VNXe MR1 (including SP1, SP2, SP3, and SP3.1) 

EMC VNXe MR2 (including SP0.1)
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access files and directories on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

EMC Celerra Network Server Version 6.0.61.0 
EMC VNX Operating Environment for File Version 7.0.53.2 
EMC VNXe MR1 SP3.2 (2.1.3.19077) 
EMC VNXe MR2 SP0.2 (2.2.0.19078)

Title: IBM System Storage Input Validation Flaws in Manager Profiler Permit Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in IBM System Storage DS Series. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The software not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2012-2172]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the IBM System Storage device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]:9000/SoftwareRegistration.do?updateRegn="><script>alert(1);</script>

A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2012-2171].

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]:9000/ModuleServlet?DeviceId=1&state=state_viewmodulelog&selectedModuleOnly=1[SQL QUERY]&selectedModule=1

The vendor was notified on April 19, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.zeroscience.mk/en/vulnerabilities/ZSL-2012-5094.php

Gjoko Krstic of Zero Science Lab reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the IBM System Storage device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.83.xx.18 and later), which removes the vulnerable component.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/connections/blogs/PSIRT/entry/secbulletin_stg-storage_cve-2012-2171_cve-2012-2172?lang=en_us

Title: HP StorageWorks Bugs Let Remote Users Traverse the Directory and Gain Administrative Access
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Some vulnerabilities were reported in HP StorageWorks. A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system. A remote user can view files on the target system.
The password file contains a default login account. A remote user can use the login credentials to perform administrative tasks.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to the web interface on TCP port 80 to view arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor was notified on June 1, 2011.

Carlos Perez at Tenable Network Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: HP StorageWorks P4000 Virtual SAN Appliance Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StorageWorks P4000 Virtual SAN Appliance. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Nicolas Gregoire of Agarri (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) and an anonymous researcher (via iDefense VCP) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c03082086

Title: HP Virtual SAN Appliance Stack Overflow in 'hydra.exe' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP Virtual SAN Appliance. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target device.
A remote user can send a specially crafted login request to 'hydra.exe' on port 13838 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with System privileges.

The vendor was notified on September 24, 2010.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-11-111

Nicolas Gregoire of Agarri reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: HP StorageWorks File Migration Agent Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the Data Store
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StorageWorks File Migration Agent. A remote user can modify the archive data store.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the 'HsmCfgSvc.exe' service to make arbitrary modifications to the archive data store.

The vendor was notified on August 25, 2010.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-11-094

AbdulAziz Hariri reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can modify the archive data store.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: HP StorageWorks X9000 Expired Password Accounts Can Be Accessed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP StorageWorks X9000.  A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can gain access to accounts with expired passwords on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has described a workaround:

   1. Explicitly disable the local Administrator account.
   2. Explicitly disable any lsassd local-provider accounts that are not in use.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02712670

Title: EMC Celerra Network Attached Storage Lets Remote Users Access the NFS Data Directory
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Celerra Network Attached Storage.  A remote user with the ability to spoof IP addresses can gain full access to the exported NFS directory.
The system grants access to remote users using an IP address white list intended for internal device communications.  A remote user can spoof certain IP addresses to mount and gain full access to the root NFS export on the target device.

The vendor was notified on May 7, 2010.

Steve Ocepek of Trustwave's SpiderLabs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to spoof IP addresses can gain full access to the exported NFS directory.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (5.6.51).

Title: Kingston DataTraveler USB Flash Drive Password Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Kingston DataTraveler flash drives. A local user can bypass access controls to access files on the target device.
A local user can modify a running version of the access control software to cause the password validation process to grant access to the local user.  The local user can then obtain files on the target device.

The following versions are affected:

DataTraveler BlackBox (DTBB)

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.syss.de/index.php?id=108&tx_ttnews[tt_news]=528&cHash=8d16fa63d9

Matthias Deeg and Sebastian Schreiber of SySS reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass access controls to access files on the target flash drive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.kingston.com/driveupdate/

Title: QNAP Storage Devices Lets Local Users Decrypt Files on the Target Device
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in QNAP Storage Devices.  A local user can decrypt the file system.
A local user can recover the key used to encrypt files on the storage device and then decrypt the files.

This vulnerability affects the TS-239 Pro and TS-639 Pro devices and possibly other devices.

Marc Heuse of Baseline Security Consulting reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.baseline-security.de/downloads/BSC-Qnap_Crypto_Backdoor-CVE-2009-3200.txt
Impact': A local user can decrypt the file system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for Time Capsule) FreeBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD kernel's IPv6 stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Apple Time Capsule is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.

Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.

Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
Apple has released a fix (firmware 7.4.1) for Time Capsule, which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3467

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for Time Capsule) FreeBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol Spoofing Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Routing Data in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol.  A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases.  Apple Time Capsule is affected.
A remote user on a physical network of an IPv6 router can spoof Neighbor Discovery messages to update routing information for a target router on a different physical network adjacent to the IPv6 router.  The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.

David Miles reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.
Solution:
Apple has released a fix (firmware 7.4.1) for Time Capsule, which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3467

Title: HP USB Floppy Drive Key for Proliant Servers May Cause Virus Infections
Version(s): Option Part #442084-B21 HP 256MB USB 2.0 Floppy Drive Key; Option Part #442085-B21 HP 1GB USB 2.0 Floppy Drive Key
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the HP USB Floppy Drive Key.  A virus infection may occur.
The device may cause a local 'W32.Fakerecy' or 'W32.SillyFDC' virus infection.
Impact': A virus infection may occur.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www12.itrc.hp.com/service/cki/docDisplay.do?docId=emr_na-c01404119
